course.title: Homer and Beyond: Theory and Comparative Methods in Studying Oral Traditions
course.description: Genres, forms, and themes of oral traditions in poetry and prose. Theories of performance and composition. Comparative metrical and formulaic analysis. Students are free to select non-Greek traditions as their focus of research, such as medieval French lays, Indic fables, Gregorian Chant, early Italian opera, Apache female initiation songs, Latin prosimetrum narratives, etc.
course.notes: Undergraduate students are welcome - including freshmen. Knowledge of Greek not required. Only Classics Department graduate students who take the course for credit will work on original Greek texts.
